intro: Rhodalsine procumbens, commonly known as the creeping rhodalsine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features slender, trailing stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread across the ground in dense mats. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or red, adding a delicate color to its habitat. Rhodalsine procumbens thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
